title: Popped Amaranth Crunch
summary: Popped Amaranth Crunch might be just the dessert you are searching for. One portion of this dish contains around 20g of protein, 35g of fat, and a total of 595 calories. This gluten free, dairy free, and vegetarian recipe serves 4 and costs $2.48 per serving. A few people made this recipe, and 20 would say it hit the spot. If you have celtic sea salt, popped amaranth grain, cashews, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 12 hours and 50 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 93%. This score is tremendous. Similar recipes are Popped Amaranth Crunch, amaranth yogurt parfait â€“ popped amaranth parfait with fruits, and Popped Amaranth and Toasted Wheat Berry Fool.
instructions: If you are baking Popped Amaranth Crunch (using soaked nuts):Place nuts on a parchment-lined cookie skeet and bake at 250F for 10-20 minutes to dry them out. In a large glass bowl, mix together all ingredients and place back on the parchment-lined cookie sheet and bake for 10-15 more minutes. Allow to cool and serve. If any is leftover (ha), store in an airtight container in your pantry.
